weather_report: Midday finds Perth under a softened sky, the light diffused and gentle, colors a touch muted, the air calm enough to invite small errands and an unhurried lunch. Through the afternoon the cloud deck looks to thicken toward a steady overcast, then loosen to broken patches by late day, letting through pale wafers of sun. Despite the veil, the UV bite remains real at this time of year; treat the light with respect. Expect a day that feels temperate rather than blazing, easy on the eyes, with no strong hint of rain—more a pewter ceiling than a threat. Dress in light layers and breathable fabrics, with a hat, sunscreen, and sunglasses for those brighter breaks. It’s a good time for everyday pleasures: a shaded café table and a slow sandwich, a library run, a tidy-up of the balcony plants, and—once the clouds begin to fray toward late afternoon—a quiet walk by the river to watch the day soften.
